greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of cycle types of degree-n permutations having the k-th smallest possible order; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 1<=k<=A009490(n), read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..60, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0 or i=1, x,
b(n, i-1)+(p-> add(coeff(p, x, t)*x^ilcm(t, i),
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0 || i == 1, x, b[n, i - 1] + Function[p, Sum[Coefficient[p, x, t]*x^LCM[t, i], {t, 1, Exponent[p, x]}]][Sum[b[n - i*j, i - 1], {j, 1, n/i}]]]; T[n_] := Function[p, Table[Function[h, If[h == 0, {{}, {}}, h]][Coefficient[p, x, i]], {i, 1, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, n]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 23 2017, translated from Maple *)
xref: Last elements of rows give A074064.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 01 2015
